result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard E Brazziel

records.addlTxt:
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 and 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 3 and 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Court orders remand for sentencing. Court orders defendant's other felony matter ( 20CF4127) set for speedy jury trial vacated and set status with other case 22CF1274. 

This Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Howard E Brazziel.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Sidebar and strike for cause conference placed on the record. . Parties advise of juror. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Jury in box: 9:25 am. Defense requests sidebar. Sidebar held. Court releases panel for break. Jury out of box: 9:28 am. Defense advises of resolutions. Court passes case for paperwork to be done.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Howard E Brazziel.  Attorney William T. Berens and Kaite Bakunowicz  and in court for State of Wisconsin.  Discussion on jury trial held. Passed for jury panel to come to court.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:39 pm. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court releases panel for the day. Court advises panel not to research, look-up or speak about the case and return at 9:00 am on 9-13-2022. Jury out of box: 4:58 pm. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Jury trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Howard E Brazziel.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin.  Arguments heard as to State's motions on first call and speedy trial issue. Court finds good cause to extend time limits of speedy for reasons stated on the record on case. Court grants state's adjournment request of case 2022CF1274. Parties advise of number one trial on defendant's other case 2022CF1511. Case passed to afternoon.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Howard E Brazziel.  Attorney William T. Berens in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial. State advises prepared on defendant's other case 22CF1511 and request adjournment on case 22CF1274 for reasons stated on the record.  Defense advises of status. Case passed for other jury trial calls.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard E Brazziel in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Howard E Brazziel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Final Pretrial held. State filed joinder motion for cases in 2022CF1274 and 2022CF1511. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court grants joinder of 2022CF1274 and 2022CF1511 for trial. Case 202CF412 will tag along. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion for Joinder.
Notice of Expert Testimony.
971.23(9) Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial.
Notice of Alibi.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard E Brazziel in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pre-trial, however state requests more time for reasons stated on the record.  Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
EXPIRES 9-12-2022

Defendant Howard Elwon Brazziel in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard Elwon Brazziel in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.   Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders any joinders motion to be filed 7-1-2022.
Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Demand of Speedy Trial from Defendant. ( Howard Brazziel- 2022004667 Milwaukee County Jail 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53223)

02:08 PM Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard E Brazziel in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion to withdraw. Defense requests to withdraw. Court grants withdraw. Defendant requests Atty Plaisted remain on case. Atty Plaisted agrees. Court grants withdraw of motion to withdraw. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Howard E Brazziel not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting more time to go through discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Howard E. Brazziel - #2022004667, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.  (Howard E. Brazziel - #2022004667, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted; both appear by video.  Defendant Howard E Brazziel in custody.  William Berens appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Milwaukee Detective M. Brus. Court took judicial notice of 05CF5729. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Parties are advised that this matter will be re-assigned to Br. 4 Judge Hanrahan due to the condition of the victim.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Plaisted is in trial, unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Howard E Brazziel in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Howard E Brazziel in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Howard E Brazziel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Case passed to provide defendant with copy of criminal complaint.  Case recalled at 03:08  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
